name: Cod with Tomato Cream Sauce
description: This silky tomato sauce with a touch of cream makes mild-flavored cod sing. Serve with farro or rice and a salad of mixed greens.
ingredients: 1 1/4 pounds cod or tilapia fillets, cut into 4 pieces
instructions: Season fish with 1 teaspoon thyme, 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add shallot, garlic and 1 teaspoon thyme; cook, stirring, until beginning to soften, about 1 minute.
Add wine, tomatoes and the fish to the pan; bring to a simmer. Cover and cook until the fish is cooked through, 4 to 6 minutes. Transfer the fish to a large plate; keep warm.
Whisk cream and cornstarch in a small bowl. Add to the pan, along with the remaining 1 teaspoon thyme and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
Divide the fish and sauce among 4 shallow bowls.
notes: Tip: For sustainably fished cod, choose U.S. Pacific cod or Atlantic cod from Iceland and the northeast Arctic.
